meanings.definition: A unit of distance equal to 220 yards or one eighth of a mile.
meanings.sent1: The horse race was just a furlong away from the finish line.
meanings.sent2: The farm stretched for many furlongs, with fields as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent3: I tried to jump a furlong in a single leap, but I barely made it a few yards.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a furlong of sunshine, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The furlong marker on the track made it easy to track the distance covered.

meanings.definition: To measure or traverse in furlongs.
meanings.sent1: We will furlong the entire field to determine its exact size.
meanings.sent2: The surveyor furlonged the land to create an accurate map.
meanings.sent3: I furlonged the hallway with my giant steps, pretending to be a giant.
meanings.sent4: She furlonged through the forest, her footsteps echoing in the quiet woods.
meanings.sent5: The explorer furlonged the unknown terrain, marking each milestone along the way.
